page.title: 07PETROCKSTOWE'S SCHOLARSHIP
page.content: Three-quarters of the people living in {Petrockstowe}had what can best be des- cribed as "state" education, although over the last 20 years education has changed so much that generalities are difficult. Three people attended Petrockstowe's village school, and two went to Shebbear College. Most locals were schooled at Hatherleigh or Torrington (variously elementary, secondary and comprehensive schools). A quarter of the present residents had a private education, 18 going to {Grammar Schools,}for entry to which they had to compete against their fellows as places were limited;10 went to{private}fee-paying{schools}(usually Church run and often boarding schools) and 5 were at{Public School.
